# Data Collection

## Location
All research is conducted in-person at UCLA.

## HBD Task
- The HBD task is programed using Psychopy.
- The HBD device is built using an Ardunio Uno3.
- The Task contains 40 trials (10 beats per trial).
- For each trial, participants responds for accuracy (Output: 1 = in-sync; 0 = out-of-sync), and confidence (0-100 continuous; Greater value = more confident.)
- "In-sync" trials have a fixed offset of 200ms.
- "Out-of-sync" trials have a fixed offset of 500ms.

## Data Storage
- The questionnaire data is stored in REDCap.
- Physiological data and HBD Task outputs are stored on Box.
